intro: Raphanistrum lampsana, commonly known as the slender burrgrass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa, Asia, and Australia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or disturbed soils and is often found in swampy or marshy habitats. Its slender, erect stems are usually covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that develop into burrs. Raphanistrum lampsana is also known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
